items.title: Malaysian Rubber Council eyes JV’s with Indian firms for bilateral trade
items.summary: High-density premium foam mattresses are one of the largest categories of rubber-based imports into India, which has witnessed a surge in demand during the last quarter

items.title: Is the US stock market open today? Check Wall Street's trading hours for Black Friday
items.summary: Stock market holiday: US stock markets closed higher for the fourth day ahead of Thanksgiving, with S&amp;P 500 up 0.7% and Nasdaq 100 up 0.87%. Investors await potential interest rate cuts in December as concerns over AI stock valuations persist.

items.title: India in talks with 50 nations for trade deals: Goyal
items.summary: India is actively pursuing trade agreements with 50 countries across 14 groups, having already finalized deals with Australia, UAE, Mauritius, the UK, and the EFTA. Discussions are also progressing with Canada for a comprehensive economic partnership, and with the US for a trade deal. Reviews of existing FTAs with ASEAN and South Korea are underway.

items.title: India needs a dual engine funding model as debt markets lag banks, says CEA Nageswaran
items.summary: India must develop deep and reliable debt capital markets to fund its next phase of growth, Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran said at a Mumbai summit. He stressed that banks alone cannot finance the massive investments needed over the next decade in sectors such as energy, logistics, infrastructure, and technology, and called for a “dual-engine” model where both banks and debt markets play distinct, complementary roles.

items.title: ₹7.35 to  ₹2430: Multibagger penny stock turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹3.30 crore in 12 years
items.summary: Since March 2023, V2 Retail's stock has surged 3,421%, becoming a major wealth creator. The company's market capitalization now stands at  ₹8,869 crore, with retail investors owning 34.4% of the shares, showcasing strong individual investor engagement in this growth story.

items.title: Market lull a buying opportunity for long-term investors, says Anshul Saigal
items.summary: Indian markets have hit fresh all-time highs, but most portfolios remain muted. Market expert Anshul Saigal says this is the ideal moment for long-term investors as valuations have corrected sharply after 14 months of consolidation. He highlights opportunities in capital goods, renewables, metals, banking, consumption and gold financiers, and explains why this phase is perfect for building quality portfolios.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 flat ahead of Q2 GDP data; Adani stocks, M&M lead gainers of Nifty 50
items.summary: Traders on a wait-and-watch approach ahead of today’s Q2 GDP print

items.title: Exato Technologies IPO day 1: GMP, subscription status, price band, other details of BSE SME IPO
items.summary: Exato Technologies’ IPO has opened with remarkable enthusiasm, fully subscribed within hours. With a strong grey market premium and significant interest from retail and institutional investors, this IPO promises to be a noteworthy event.&nbsp;

items.title: Premier Energies feels the heat as solar cycle turns tougher
items.summary: Investors are more concerned over the next phase of the industry cycle and the impact it will have on Premier’s profit margins, which are hovering around peak levels.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 at record high! Can the rally in Indian stock market weigh on gold, silver prices?
items.summary: Nifty 50 and Sensex continue to rise, reaching new highs with Sensex at 86,055.86 and Nifty at 26,310.45. Despite profit-booking, both indices maintain a winning streak. Gold and silver prices have also surged, supported by global uncertainties and demand from central banks.

items.summary: Moody's also said that India's domestic growth drivers underpin its economic resilience amid global uncertainty

items.title: Japan's Nikkei adds to weekly gain with eyes on central bank meetings
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei 225 closed up 0.2% on Friday, extending its weekly gain despite a challenging November. Investor focus is shifting to upcoming central bank decisions, with Tokyo's core inflation hinting at a potential Bank of Japan rate hike. U.S. tech stocks' performance hinges on the Federal Reserve's December interest rate outlook.

items.title: Apollo Pharmacy targets 10 crore customer base in 5 years, to open 2 new stores per day: CEO
items.summary: Apollo Pharmacy plans an aggressive expansion, aiming to open two new stores daily to reach a customer base of 10 crore within five years. Having surpassed 7,000 stores, the omni-channel network seeks to enhance its neighbourhood presence and ensure widespread access to quality medicines. The company also reported its loyalty program, Apollo Circle, has crossed 10 million members.

items.title: Paytm share price rises over 3% as Goldman Sachs lifts target by 123% to  ₹1,570 on improving growth visibility
items.summary: Paytm shares rose 3.4% to  ₹1,325 after Goldman Sachs upgraded its rating to ‘Buy’ and raised the target price to  ₹1,570. The brokerage anticipates 20-25% annual revenue growth over the next 2-3 years, following regulatory improvements and market share recovery.

items.title: GAIL shares down 4% after PNGRB announces 12% tariff hike
items.summary: The tariff order raises the integrated pipeline rate from ₹58.60 per MMBtu to ₹65.69, and will come into effect from January 1, 2026

items.title: Bandhan Bank to sell Rs 6932 crore of bad loans
items.summary: Bandhan Bank is offloading bad loans worth Rs 6,932 crore to improve its balance sheet, focusing on micro and agriculture loans. The Kolkata-based lender is selling non-performing loans exceeding 180 days overdue and auctioning written-off loans to address significant stress in its asset quality, which has impacted profitability.

items.title: CICC Set to Pay 2024 Bonuses to China Bankers After Long Delay
items.summary: China International Capital Corp. is set to finally distribute its 2024 bonuses after a crackdown on banker compensation and an ongoing acquisition caused a lengthy delay.

items.title: India’s revised labour laws fail to address a silent crisis. They leave countless workers vulnerable to job losses
items.summary: India’s four labour codes are broadly welcome, but they miss addressing the concerns of workers in the services sector, where mass layoffs are common. Should the codes not have made provisions for a stronger safety net for those vulnerable to a sudden job loss? Advanced economies offer cues.

items.title: India in talks for free trade deals with 50 nations: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India is actively pursuing free trade agreements with several global partners. Discussions are underway with the United States and the European Union. The Gulf Cooperation Council also seeks trade pact talks. India is reviewing existing agreements with ASEAN and Korea. Negotiations are also progressing with Eurasia, Israel, Canada, South Africa, and Mercosur.

items.title: JioSaavn crosses 500 million downloads on Google Play
items.summary: JioSaavn has achieved a significant milestone, surpassing 500 million downloads on the Google Play Store, making it the sole Indian music streaming service to reach this scale. This growth, fueled by product enhancements and strategic subscription offers, solidifies its position in the competitive audio streaming market.

items.title: Zerodha Fund House crosses  ₹10,000 crore AUM in just two years - redefines passive investing in India
items.summary: Zerodha Fund House has crossed &nbsp; ₹10,000 crore in assets under management in just two years, showcasing rapid growth in India's asset management sector. Its focus on index-based funds and direct plans has attracted over 8 lakh investors.

items.title: Cement makers focus on volumes amid flat prices, rising competition
items.summary: Cement prices remain range-bound and companies are looking to prioritize volume-led growth to protect market share amid renewed competitive pressure.

items.title: India to lead emerging market growth with 7% GDP rise in 2025: Moody’s
items.summary: Its projected average GDP growth in APAC (Asia-Pacific) will remain steady at 3.4% in 2026 compared with 3.3% in 2024 and expected growth of 3.6% in 2025

items.title: Aakash Educational Services blocks BYJU’S parent TLPL’s rights issue subscription, citing compliance concerns
items.summary: Aakash Educational Services Ltd has paused share allotment to BYJU'S parent company, Think & Learn Pvt Ltd. This action follows concerns regarding the source of Rs 25 crore deposited for a rights issue. Legal experts suggest the funds may violate regulations. The National Company Law Tribunal is examining the claims.

items.summary: Early investors in Meesho, including Elevation Capital, Peak XV and Y Combinator, are set for major gains in the IPO’s offer-for-sale as they sell 10.38 crore shares at ₹111 each. Their combined initial investment of about ₹131 crore has grown to over ₹1,020 crore — translating into returns of roughly ₹877 for every ₹100 invested.

items.title: Gold, silver futures gain on firm global cues as Fed rate cut hope strengthens

items.summary: Meesho’s Rs 5,421-crore IPO is drawing strong interest, with grey market trends indicating a potential 30% listing premium. Upcoming triggers include robust festive demand, JioMart expansion, elevated refining margins, and Jio’s expected 2026 IPO.

Customers can explore the latest products and attend free sessions. This expansion comes as Apple sees record sales in India.

items.title: Australian shares log decade's worst November as expensive banks slide
items.summary: Australian shares experienced their worst November in over a decade, with the S&P/ASX 200 index falling 3%. Heavyweight banks declined due to lofty valuations and margin pressures, while strong inflation and employment data diminished hopes for near-term rate cuts. Resources stocks, however, continued their upward trend.

This move seeks to make the financial hub more attractive to lessors, boosting India's presence in the $187 billion aircraft leasing business currently dominated by Ireland.

The e-Vitara will feature advanced technology and multiple battery options. Maruti Suzuki is also building a dedicated EV ecosystem to support the launch. The electric SUV is expected to be priced competitively.

items.summary: This is Apple's third retail store opening in India in 2025, after it opened outlets in Bengaluru and Pune. However, a sixth store opening, which Apple is already working on, is unlikely to take place this calendar year.

He explains what will bring FIIs back, why the US–India trade deal matters, and how investors should position across BFSI, consumption, IT, and multicap strategies.

Bitcoin and Ethereum are trading above recent gains, with markets preparing for potential future movements.

items.title: Sudeep Pharma shares rally 8% after solid listing pop. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: Sudeep Pharma’s strong stock market debut turned into an early rally, with shares gaining up to 8% after listing at a nearly 24% premium to the IPO price. The Rs 895 crore issue drew heavy demand across all investor categories, reflecting confidence in the company’s position in speciality pharma ingredients. While analysts see long-term potential backed by high margins and strong export presence, they advise caution on near-term risks such as margin pressure and raw material volatility, suggesting partial profit booking with a disciplined stop-loss.

items.summary: GMDC shares fell after a three-day surge as traders booked profits, following strong gains driven by a government incentive to boost rare earth magnet production. The stock faced short-term technical resistance, though long-term trends remain positive. Profit taking set in after optimism around GMDC’s role in India’s strategic minerals push.

items.title: The missing pillar of Atmanirbhar Bharat: Financial services
items.summary: India’s Atmanirbhar Bharat vision needs a sixth pillar—financial self-reliance. As domestic savings, market participation, and long-term capital grow, India can increasingly fund its own development. Strengthening local market intermediaries, payment systems, and asset managers is essential to reduce external dependence and build a resilient, sovereign financial ecosystem.

Institutional investors are increasing their real estate allocations. This trend offers stability and diversification. Flexible funding beyond traditional banks is crucial for project execution and urban development.

Historically, December offers an average 1.6% return, with Nifty closing higher 60% of the time over the past decade. FIIs and DIIs have shown a generally positive flow, influencing market performance.

This initiative aims to create a future-ready workforce for manufacturing and emerging technology sectors, boosting employability for 1.3 million Indian youth with industry-aligned and green skills training.

items.title: India bonds dip before debt sale; GDP data to guide rate-cut bets

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 28 November 2025: Stock markets end flat in highly volatile trade ahead of GDP, IIP data
items.summary:
Benchmark stock indices Sensex and Nifty closed almost unchanged in a highly volatile trade on Friday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of key macroeconomic data announcements in post-market hours.

Halting its two-day rally, the 30-share BSE Sensex slipped by 13.71 points or 0.02 per cent to settle at 85,706.67. During the day, it hit a high of 85,969.89 and a low of 85,577.82, gyrating 392.07 points.

The 50-share NSE Nifty skidded 12.60 points or 0.05 per cent to 26,202.95.

The key indices had raced to record highs in intra-day trade on Thursday but ended almost flat due to profit

items.title: How Bangladesh is bringing onion exporters to tears
items.summary: The Indian onion export market is experiencing a downturn as longtime clients such as Bangladesh and Saudi Arabia pivot to suppliers in Pakistan and China. This change comes after India imposed export limits to stabilize local prices. Industry insiders caution that India's onion seeds are empowering these rival nations towards self-sufficiency, threatening the stronghold of Indian farmers in global markets.

items.title: Subdued H2 credit offtake ahead for banks, NBFCs: CareEdge
items.summary: Any incremental growth is likely going to be driven by a pickup in retail lending segments such as housing, MSME, two-wheelers, and gold loans. But analysts expect the asset quality to remain stable, despite growing retail demand. The agency has upgraded its credit growth outlook to 11.5%-12.5% for FY26, up from an earlier average growth of 11.13% in FY25. The Gross non performing assets (GNPA) for overall banks is expected to improve to 2.1% in FY26 from 2.3% in FY25.

items.title: Haleon may rope in ex-MD of Castrol India to head local biz
items.summary: Haleon India is reportedly set to appoint Kedar Lele, the outgoing MD of Castrol India, as its new chief early next year. Lele will succeed Navneet Saluja, who retired in October. This appointment marks another leadership change in India's legacy consumer sector, with Haleon India managing popular brands like Sensodyne and Crocin.

items.title: EVs likely to power 25% of Mahindra & Mahindra's SUV sales by 2028

With estimates indicating that electric models could account for 20-25% of their SUV sales, the company is poised to make waves with the launch of the family-friendly XEV 9S in January 2026.

items.title: Rapid CTV rise could bring 'balance' to streaming world
items.summary: India's streaming universe is evolving like never before. As Connected TV usage surges, we may witness a welcome variety in storytelling. While male-lead narratives currently reign supreme, the trend of watching together on CTVs suggests an impending change. With platforms keenly analyzing viewer habits, we can expect an enriching assortment of programming that caters to a broader audience spectrum.

items.title: Relief for employers: New labour codes slash jail provisions to 22
items.summary: New labour codes significantly reduce imprisonment provisions for employers, from 87 to 22, with most offenses now compoundable. This aims to ease compliance while strengthening worker protection. The reforms introduce "improvement notices" before prosecution and decriminalize procedural violations, fostering a more facilitative regulatory environment.

items.title: Whirlpool offloads 11.2% stake in Indian unit through bulk deals
items.summary: Whirlpool Corporation has sold an 11.2% stake in its Indian subsidiary, Whirlpool of India. This move is part of a larger plan to reduce its ownership. The sale generated approximately ₹1,490 crore. The parent company aims to complete its stake reduction by the first half of 2026. Proceeds will be used to repay debt.

items.title: Generic HIV drug rollout to take a hit on trial push
items.summary: India's decision to reject a waiver for local clinical trials of a new HIV drug, lenacapavir, is causing concern. Public health experts warn this will delay access to the affordable generic version for millions in India and other low-income nations. Drug maker Hetero Labs sought the waiver to speed up the launch of the treatment.

items.title: Chinese tourists come knocking, but India's doors barely open
items.summary: Indian tour operators report challenges in attracting Chinese tourists. Visa delays, daily quotas, and city restrictions are impacting business. This comes after India resumed tourist visas for Chinese nationals following a five-year pause. Tour companies urge for faster approvals and the reinstatement of e-visas to tap into this significant market. Current visa appointment systems are described as difficult to navigate.

items.title: Government forms panel to strengthen key recovery law

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 27th November 2025: After scaling record highs in early trade, benchmark indices end with marginal gains
items.summary:
Benchmark stock indices Sensex and Nifty scaled fresh lifetime highs in intra-day trade on Thursday before closing marginally higher amid positive global trends on growing hopes of a US Fed rate cut and foreign fund inflows.

Rising for the second day, the 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 110.87 points or 0.13 per cent to settle at 85,720.38. During the day, it hit a record high of 86,055.86, reflecting a jump of 446.35 points or 0.52 per cent. The earlier lifetime high of the benchmark was 85,978.25 hit on September 27, 2024.

The 50-share NSE Nifty ended marginally higher by 10.25 points or 0.04

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 26th November 2025: Sensex jumps 1,022.50 points; Nifty inches near record high on US fed rate cut hopes
items.summary:
Snapping the three-day falling streak, benchmark Sensex rebounded by 1,022 points while Nifty reclaimed the 26,000 level on Wednesday on across-the-board buying aided by a rally in global peers amid growing hopes of a US Fed rate cut and fresh foreign fund inflows.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 1,022.50 points or 1.21 per cent to settle at 85,609.51. During the day, it surged 1,057.18 points or 1.24 per cent to 85,644.19.

The 50-share NSE Nifty zoomed 320.50 points or 1.24 per cent to end at 26,205.30, just 10 points shy of its all time high.

In intra-day trade, Nifty rallied 330.35 points

items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
